events.name: Google Chrome Extension - Online Notifier
events.description:
Agenda:

• Recap av GDG London Summit av Asbjørn A. Fellinghaug

• Hva er nytt i Android 4.4 "KitKat" av Martin M. Syvertsen

• Intro til Android Studio av Martin M. Syvertsen

• Michael Johansen (@JohansenMichael) presenterer sin Chrome Extension - "Online Notifier". Denne utvidelsen kan ses her: http://goo.gl/IV7uQ8

Viktig info:

• Dørene til Beddingen 10 krever adgangskort etter 17 så ring[masked] (Martin) for å komme inn

• Beddingen 10 er på Solsiden i samme bygg som Solsiden Kjøpesenter

events.name: Android og/eller Chrome Cast hacking
events.description:
Møt opp og hack på enten Android eller Chromecast. Målet med denne meetupen er å møtes og hacke. Det blir fokus på Android og Chromecast så har du en Android telefon eller en Chromecast, eller er bare nysgjerrig på en eller begge, så er det bare å møte opp. Det er såklart også lov å møte opp og hacke på andre ting om du ønsker dette.

Denne meetupen er perfekt for deg som: vil hacke litt Android eller Chromecast, vil lære å kode Android, lære å kode mot Chromecast

Praktisk info:

- Vi stiller desverre ikke med noe utstyr så du må ta med PC og eventuelt utstyr selv, men vi skal nok klare å finne noen strømkabler du kan koble deg til.

- Sted blir:
Kjelhuset (rom nr: 251), Gløshaugen, NTNU - Mer info kommer!

events.name: Android and Bluetooth Smart!
events.description:
Det er tid for en GDG meetup igjen!

Denne gang retter vi fokus mot "bluetooth smart". Den Trondheimsbaserte bedriften Nordic Semiconductor er en storprodusent innen slike integrerte trådløse kretser som bluetooth smart, og vi skal derfor ta en nærmere titt på hvordan prate / bruke slike enheter fra en Android app.

Vi kommer til å kikke først på hva Bluetooth Smart er og hva som skal til for å kunne kalle en trådløst protokoll "low energy". Så ser vi på API'et til Android og hvordan man enkelt kan bruke dette til å raskt lage applikasjoner for å interagere med 'ting'.

Vegar Westerlund (@vegarwe) fra Conceptos Consulting jobber med testing av Bluetooth Smart kretser fra Nordic Semiconductor. 

Selve meetupen blir holdt ved Statoils Forskningssenter på Rotvoll: se kart her.

Statoil sponser pizza til alle deltakere!
events.how_to_find_us: Ta buss 6 til "Rotvoll", deretter er det en 5-10 minuttes gåtur ned til Forskningssenteret. Alternativt så er det gratis parkering hos Statoil fra og med kl.17.

events.name: Chromecast Hackaton
events.description:
GDG Trondheim i sammarbeid med Digs og Dataforeningen arrangerer nok et hackaton der vi møter opp og koder på noe gøy. Denne gangen skal vi se på Chromecast og prøve å få denne kule lille pinnen til å gjøre noe fornuftig (eller ufornuftig). Kvelden starter med en liten presentasjon på hva Chromecast er og litt ABC om Chromecast APIet, deretter setter vi oss ned og hacker på det vi måtte ønske. Hackaton er ment for alle utviklere som har enten lyst til å lære noe nytt eller hacke på noe de kan sammen med andre og gjerne vise frem noe kult de har gjort om de ønsker. Målet med kvelden er ikke nødvendigvis å bli ferdig med et superfantastisk prosjekt, men rett og slett komme i gang med noe og kanskje få noen ideer og litt inspirasjon.

Om Chromecast:

Chromecast er en strømmeenhet på størrelse med en USB-minnebrikke. Du plugger den i HDMI-inngangen på TV-en, og setter den opp med en enkel mobilapp. Deretter kan du sende alt favorittinnholdet ditt fra nettet – TV-programmer, filmer, musikk og mer – til TV-en via smarttelefonen,

events.name: Google Cloud - Demystifying App Engine
events.description:
Google Developer Group in cooperation with XP/Agile Meetup will do a short presentation of Google App Engine. We will explain what it is, what it does and how you can use it. Then we will dive in a quick hack session where everyone can get started with App Engine.

App Engine can be used in a variety of languages, so each and everyone can experiment with what they’re familiar with: Java, Python, Go-lang and PHP.

For the hack session the goal will be to create a simple JSON based web service that uses the yr.no API.

events.name: The Go Programming Language
events.description:
Vi får besøk av Martin Polden (@mpolden) som skal fortelle oss litt mer om Go Programming Language - også kjent som golang - ble lansert i 2007 av et utviklingsteam hos Google.

Vi skal ta en nærmere titt på Go, og sammen bli litt klokere på hvordan språket ser ut samt typiske bruksområder.

Agenda:

• Bakgrunn og historie

• Oversikt over features

• Designprinsipper

• Pakker, testing og tooling

• Typiske bruksområder

events.name: Go-lang in the Cloud
events.description:
Vi starter opp GDG meetups igjen med Go-lang og sky som tema. 

Meetupen er tenkt som en hackathon der du tar med PCen (eller Macen) din og hacker i lag med andre på Go-lang og kanskje noen skyløsninger som støtter Go som f.eks App Engine eller Heroku. Det vil bli en kort presentasjon av Go-lang i skyen i starten. Om du bare er nysgjerrig på Go-lang eller skyen så er det bare å møte opp, med eller uten PC.

Om du skal møte opp med egen maskin kan det være kjekt å sette opp Go først, men du trenger ikke såklart. Her er noen nyttige lenker:

https://golang.org/

https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/go/gettingstarted/introduction

https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/getting-started-with-go#introduction

https://golang.org/doc/articles/wiki/

Om du trenger en Go editor så kan Atom+Go-plus anbefalles:

https://atom.io/

https://atom.io/packages/go-plus

events.name: Next 17' Extended - Trondheim
events.description:
Google Cloud Next 17' Extended

Vi tar for oss enkelte utvalgte temaer fra årets Cloud Next 17' med et fokus på software utvikling.

Agenda:

• Rask intro av Cloud Next 17'

• Foreslåtte codelabs:

• Firebase Web Codelab: Lage en Nodejs webapp der vi implementerer og deployer en chat klient ved bruk av Firebase.

• "Building a gRPC service with Node.js"

• "Build a Node.js Web Appp using Google Cloud Platform"

Denne meetup'en er i samarbeid med "Trondheim XP and Agile meetup"!

NB: Ta med laptop + strømforsyning. 

Kaféen er åpen med et utmerket utvalg av diverse leskedrikker!

events.name: Let’s Build an App Together (Series/Workshop)
events.description:
Let's build an Android app together using Firebase along with top open-source Android frameworks. How about building a photo sharing app, "Trondheim's Photo of the day" or "Dagens bilde fra Trondheim" in Norwegian. The photo with the most likes or ratings get pushed(push-notification) daily to all users.

This would be an open-source project and we would add more features as we develop it together. Feel free to send us your feature request or suggestions.

 Suggested firebase features:
- Authentication
- Cloud storage
- Realtime Database
- Crash reporting
- Analytics
- Remote Config
- Cloud Messaging
- Notifications

Mission:

Build a photo sharing app using Firebase

What's going on?

19:00 - 19:15 - Doors open

19:15 - 19:30 - Short presentation on Firebase 

19:30 - 20:30 - Codelab 

20:30 - 21:00 - Break (Pizza & Soft-drinks)

21:00 - 21:30 - Codelab 

21:30 - 22:00 - Demos

What you need:

PC with Android Studio 2.1+

Android device / Emulator with Google Play Services

events.name: ​Curating Online Content with Google ML APIs
events.description:
Topic: Machine Learning, Google, API

Description: Google Cloud Machine Learning provides modern machine learning services, with pre-trained models and a service to generate your own tailored models. Major Google applications use Cloud Machine Learning, including Photos (image search), the Google app (voice search), Translate, and Inbox (Smart Reply). In this talk, combining Cloud Vision with Prediction API I will show you real use case with many applications, useful for those consuming online content.  

Presenter: 

Andres L. Martinez-Ortiz a.k.a almo is Head of Developer Program in Google's Engineering team for several countries in Europe. He is focused on driving the success of Google's developer products and the open web by creating a thriving ecosystem of 3rd party applications and businesses built on them. Closely with Product Management, Marketing, PR, Business Development, and other, he works with and supports developer communities, initiating activities that meet the needs of the innovation ecosystem. In addition, he meets with developers and partners in large companies, startups, universities and enterprises, promoting Open standards and Google technologies. He is also member of IEEE, ACM, Linux Foundation and Computer Society.

@davilagrau


FIY: Webstep is sponsoring pizza's for this event, so please RSVP if you will attend or not. Also, there are people on the waiting list.

events.name: Android Runtime Permissions Handling With EasyPermissions
events.description:
Ernest S. Kamara from ZEDGE will talk about Android runtime permissions handling with EasyPermissions in a mini-workshop.
He will go through some simple and complex examples on handling Android runtime permissions and why you should use EasyPermissions.

EasyPermissions is a lightweight Android open source library by Google that helps you with Android Runtime Permissions. EasyPermissions is very
easy to integrate in your projects and is used in many Google sample apps and other production apps.

Agenda:
18.00: Pizza & mingling sponsored by Webstep!
18.15: Short talk with live demo
19:00: Try it out mini-workshop

What you need:
Laptop with Android Studio 2.1+
Android Support Library[masked]
Android device / Emulator

Thanks to ZEDGE for hosting us and Webstep for providing Pizza.

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Trondheim
events.description:
Google's annual developer conference, kicks off May 8th and you are invited to watch the live-stream of the opening keynote with other community members at Work-Work, Trondheim.

Meet other likeminded people and learn and discuss about Google's latest product and platform innovations.

There will be some food & drinks and giveaways throughout the event so make sure to stick around the whole time!

We hope to see you here.

#io18extended is official hashtag, add #gdgtrondheim for our event
Check out https://events.google.com/io/ for more info.

events.name: Hello Flutter!
events.description:
Flutter is another open-source cross-platform framework prepared for mobile app platforms. Since its "beta release", in the end of March, it got huge attention on Github and appeared to be one of the most trending repos.
Join us to discover its neat features!
- Android & iOS - brief history, problems
- Flutter - what's new?
- Comparison with React Native and others
- Dart (2) - short intro to language
- Get Started Tutorial
- Widget - the UI programming in Flutter
- Can Flutter be used from Android/iOS code (and vice-versa)?
- Integration with existing apps
- Fuchsia (Android replacement)
- Codelabs

There will be some food & drinks (soda and beer) sponsored by Webstep and Flutter.io

We hope to see you here.

events.name: Microservices Architecture & Message Queues
events.description:
Topic:
Introduction to Microservices Architecture and Message Queues

Description:
In the last few years we have seen how new architecture patters have arisen in order to better serve the latest technology trends. One of the most popular ones is Microservices Architecture, where a set of small, independent and modular services interact with each other to serve a business goal. In this talk we will give an overview of how do microservices work, why and when to use them, and how to orchestrate them using message queues.

Presenter:
Arturo Calvo is a Technology Architect at Accenture. He combines 13 years of experience as a software engineer in startups, academia and multinationals in 5 different countries. He founded 3 startups in the past, and he is a mentor at different entrepreneurship programmes. His interests include Artificial Intelligence, Microservices, Design Thinking and Lean Startup.

Web: arturocalvo.com
Twitter:@artucalvo

Thanks to ZEDGE for hosting us and Accenture for sponsoring food and drinks for this event.

events.name: Google DevFest 2018 Trondheim
events.description:
It's official! GDG-Trondheim is going to host its first GDG DevFest and you are invited to a single day ticketed developer conference on Mobile, Web, Cloud and other emerging technologies.

Reasons to attend DevFest 2018 Trondheim:
- Meet passionate developers in your community
- Learn about software craftsmanship and progressive technologies from an array of experts
- Discover how technology can solve problems and help drive innovation
- Explore the vibrant city of Trondheim, the third largest city in Norway

Who should attend:
Developers and designer of all levels. There’s something in the programme for everyone.

To find out more about speakers, topics and agenda as they get announced, visit >> http://bit.ly/DFestTrdAgenda

Code of Conduct
We are committed to providing a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all. Learn more on >> http://bit.ly/DFestTrdCOC

events.name: Kotlin Study Jam
events.description:
Would you like to get started with Kotlin or hangout with other Kotlin enthusiast in town? This event is for you! We will be hosting four Kotlin study jams as we work our way through the Udacity Kotlin Bootcamp for Programmers course.

Study Jams are community-organized study groups around Google online developer courses. The goal is to support as many as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.

At each study jam we will cover a session from the course, discuss questions and issues at hand as we go along. There will be some Kotlin developers tutoring this course and hope to share some PRO TIPS and experiences with Kotlin.

Schedule
* Session 1: Monday,[masked], 6-8pm [Kotlin Basics]
* Session 2: TBA [Functions & Classes]
* Session 3: TBA [Kotlin Essentials: Beyond the Basics]
* Session 4: TBA [Coroutines]

Slack
Please join the #kotlin-study-jam slack channel in the gdg-trondheim.slack.com slack group for questions and feedback as we go along.

More about this course: https://www.udacity.com/course/kotlin-bootcamp-for-programmers--ud9011

Prerequisites
You need a laptop and it's best if you have been programming for at least 1 year, and are comfortable with an IDE, such as IntelliJ or Android Studio

Code of conduct:
https://www.google.com/events/policy/anti-harassmentpolicy.html

There will be some food & drinks (soda and beer) sponsored by Webstep.

We hope to see you here.

events.name: Playing with GCP Pub/Sub and Python
events.description:
Please register your attendence in the Trondheim Python Meetup group: http://meetu.ps/e/HlRDr/1KnnD/d

NOTE: New date - 18th of November!
events.how_to_find_us: Second floor. You will be let in.

events.name: Collaborative Virtual Event - Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
We are excited to announce our Flutter Study Jam, a virtual event by Flutter Oslo Meetup Group, GDG Oslo, GDG Bergen, GDG Sorlandet and GDG Stavanger collaboration.

Note: Link to join the event will be announced soon.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Join us for our Online Flutter Study Jam!

Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build an app while learning the fundamentals.

The Study Jams for Flutter is best suited for two audiences:

1) Those with programming experience who have never used flutter and want to see what’s it all about.

2) People who have some experience with Flutter and want to learn new ways to implement mobile/web apps in.

IMPORTANT INFO:
Prepare a laptop! For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Please check if after installing Flutter SDK your laptop can compile and run a basic empty app in Flutter.

Check out: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

Please install Visual Studio Code if you don't have Android Studio already set up
How to install VsCode: https://flutter.dev/docs/development/tools/vs-code

Windows setup: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/windows
Mac setup: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/macos
Linux setup: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/linux

Agenda:
17:00 - Welcome talk
17:15 - Start
20:00/20:30 - End

About Instructors:

Muhammed Salih Guler:

Salih is a Berlin-based Senior Mobile Engineer who is a Google Developer Expert for Flutter and Dart. He likes sharing his knowledge with the people by mentoring aspiring developers, blogging and talking at conferences.

Majid Hajian:

Majid is a passionate software developer with years of developing and architecting complex web and mobile applications. He is passionate about web platform especially Flutter, IoT, PWAs, and performance. He loves sharing his knowledge with the community by writing and speaking, contributing to open source and organizing meetups and events. Majid is the award-winning author of "Progressive web app with Angular" book by Apress and "Progressive Web Apps" video course by PacktPub and Udemy. He is (co)organizer of a few mobile and web meetups in Norway as well as Nordic conferences for mobile and Angular, Mobile Era and ngVikings.

events.name: Collaborative virtual event: Angular evening with 3 great sessions
events.description:
We are excited to announce our Angular evening talks! a virtual event by Angular Oslo, Angular Stavanger and GDG Oslo, GDG Bergen, GDG Sørlandet, GDG Stavanger and GDG Trondheim collaboration

The link to watch will be announced soon.

----
Title:
The future of Angular and Ivy by Manfred Steyer

Abstract:
Ivy is primarily associated with smaller bundles and therefore better performance. However, Ivy has much more to offer, and many smart concepts provide the foundation for some much-anticipated future features.

Find out how Ivy's potential can impact your future architecture. We use a case study to explore a possible future without NgModules but Standalone Components, the use of dynamic components or higher-order components, zone-less change detection, and new possibilities for lazy loading and plug-in systems.

In the end, you understand Ivy's potential and how to start preparing for it today.

------------------------

Title: TBD by Fabriece Sumuni
Abstract: TBD

------------------------

Title: Angular Elements for Authentication: The what, the how and the why by Ana Cidre

Abstract:
In this talk, we will take a look at what Angular Elements are, what they consist of and how to build them. Then we will see what advantages Web Components have when approaching and implementing authentication into our application, how Web Components can facilitate the implementation of authentication and share some examples of which Web Components we can create to simplify the process. We will also talk about what options we have today to build Web Components, which frameworks support them and whether browsers are ready for them.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Our Speakers' biography:

Manfred Steyer:
Trainer, consultant and programming architect with a focus on Angular. Google Developer Expert (GDE) and Trusted Collaborator in the Angular team who writes for O'Reilly, the German Java Magazine, and windows.developer. He regularly speaks at conferences.

Ana Cidre:
Ana is a Developer Advocate at Auth0. She has a degree in Fine Arts and a Master in International Business Economics and Management, so she is not your usual software developer. She loves to code and she especially likes Angular. As a very active member of the community, she regularly organises meetups and conferences, like the amazing ngSpain. In Spain, where she’s currently based, she’s an organiser of GDG Vigo and the founder of GalsTech, a group for women in tech from Galicia. Because she is so passionate about diversity, she has also been named a Women Techmaker Ambassador.

Fabriece Sumuni:
TBD

events.name: [Online] JSON Data Modeling in Document Databases
events.description:
This is an event hosted by GDG-Cloud-Norway, so go there and signup for attendance: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Cloud-Norway/events/269693810/

Description:

**Talk:**
JSON Data Modeling in Document Databases.

If you’re thinking about using a document database, it can be intimidating to start. A flexible data model gives you a lot of choices, but which way is the right way? Is a document database even the right tool?

In this session we’ll go over the basics of data modeling using JSON. We’ll compare and contrast with traditional RDBMS modeling. Impact on application code will be discussed, as well as some tooling that could be helpful along the way. The examples use the free, open-source Couchbase Server document database, but the principles from this session can also be applied to CosmosDb, Mongo, RavenDb, etc.

**Speaker:**
Matthew D. Groves is a guy who loves to code. It doesn't matter if it's C#, jQuery, or PHP: he'll submit pull requests for anything. He has been coding professionally ever since he wrote a QuickBASIC point-of-sale app for his parent's pizza shop back in the 90s. He currently works as a Developer Advocate for Couchbase. His free time is spent with his family, watching the Reds, and getting involved in the developer community. He is the author of AOP in .NET (published by Manning), and is also a Microsoft MVP.

events.name: [Online] The GUI is a prison: Automate your GCP infrastructure with Ansible!
events.description:
This is an event hosted by GDG-Cloud-Norway, so go there and signup for attendance: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Cloud-Norway/events/269693769/

**Talk:**
The GUI is a prison: Automate your GCP infrastructure with Ansible!

Configuring your infrastructure through the GUI or shell is a buggy, time consuming, hard to audit and error prone exercise. In this session learn how to use Ansible to configure GCP via code: instances, databases, pub-sub, networks, & much more. Learn practical tips, tricks, and demo code to get you started right away and learn why you'll never want to use the GUI again.

**Speaker:**
Bill Dinger

Bill is a Senior Technical Lead at Ameritas working on delivering digital solutions to our clients. Over the last 15 years Bill has worked in enterprise IT starting in the trenches on the help desk. After that, Bill spent almost a decade working in infrastructure support focusing in the Microsoft stack. Over the last 5 years Bill has been developing, architecting and leading teams of software developers. During that time Bill has done everything from troubleshoot dial up connections in rural Nebraska to building the digital experiences for some of America's most well known brands.

When not working, Bill will probably be found on his bike exploring gravel roads in his hometown of Lincoln, Nebraska.

events.name: [Online] Container Tips and Tricks
events.description:
This is an event hosted by GDG-Cloud-Norway, so go there and signup for attendance: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Cloud-Norway/events/270296229/

**Talk:**
Everyone is talking about containers—but be aware! It takes discipline to use container technology. It may not be as secure nor as optimal as you thought it would be. Although it’s relatively easy to create a new immutable container image to run everywhere, you may have fallen into many of the caveats. Is it running as the root user? Why are the images taking so much space? Why did your containers run out of space in the first place!? Most importantly, your container images may not be as immutable nor repeatable as you thought, and your Java process might be overutilizing assigned resources! Attend this session to learn how to best address these issues when building your Java container images.

**Speaker:**
Ray Tsang
Ray is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform and a Java Champion. Ray works with engineering and product teams to improve Java developer productivity on GCP. Ray also help Alphabet companies migrate and adopt cloud native architecture. Prior to Google, Ray worked at Red Hat, Accenture, and other consulting companies. Ray focused on enterprise architecture, managed solutions delivery, and contributed to open source projects. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.
